meanings.definition: To release from bonds or restraints.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unbinds the rope from the tree.
meanings.sent2: He unbinds the handcuffs to set the prisoner free.
meanings.sent3: The magician unbinds himself from the chains with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: The hero unbinds the captured princess, setting her free from the evil sorcerer's grasp.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unbinds the scroll, revealing the ancient writing within.

meanings.definition: To free from fastening or attachment.
meanings.sent1: He carefully unbinds the boat from the dock.
meanings.sent2: She unbinds the necklace from her neck before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel unbinds the kite from the tree, sending it soaring into the sky.
meanings.sent4: The sun unbinds the colors of the rainbow after the storm, painting the sky with beauty.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle tug, he unbinds the knot, releasing the package from its wrapping.
